Class Command

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.Command
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AcceptCommand, AddCrewCommand, BuildingCommand, ChoosingPlanetsCommand, ConsumeEnergyCommand, DebugShip, DefendFromLargeCommand, DefendFromSmallCommand, FinishBuildingCommand, GiveAttackCommand, GiveSpeedCommand, HandleCargoCommand, KillCommand, LobbyCommand, LoginCommand, QuitCommand, ReadyCommand, ReconnectCommand, RemoveTileCommand, SelectChunkCommand, Theft, TheftCommand
public abstract class Command extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a base abstract class for all game commands, providing a framework for various command types within the game system. Each specific command type extends this class to implement custom behavior. This class uses Jackson annotations to enable polymorphic serialization and deserialization of different command types. It defines common properties and abstract behavior that all command implementations must support. Command serialization utilizes the `commandType` property to distinguish between subclasses during de/serialization.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • gameId

      public String gameId
      Represents the unique identifier for a game associated with this command. This field is used to distinguish and reference a specific game instance in the context of the application. The `gameId` ensures that operations or commands are executed within the correct game environment.

    • playerId

      public String playerId
      Represents the unique identifier of the player associated with this command. This ID is used to specify the player that the command is targeting or is executed by. The `playerId` serves as a crucial link between the command and the specific player, enabling individualized actions or behaviors in the game context. It is serialized and deserialized using the `@JsonProperty` annotation to ensure smooth data exchange in JSON-based communication.

    • lv

      public int lv
      Represents the level (lv) associated with the command. This value is used to denote the level at which the command operates or is applicable within the game's logic. Annotated with @JsonProperty to allow serialization and deserialization to and from JSON, ensuring the variable is correctly mapped during data exchange processes.

    • title

      public String title
      Represents the title or name of the command. This field is used to assign a descriptive or identifiable name to the command for better understanding and reference in the game. It is serialized and deserialized using Jackson annotations for seamless compatibility with JSON-based data exchange.

    • token

      public String token
      Represents the authentication or validation token associated with a command. This field is used to ensure secure and authorized execution of commands within the system. The token may be provided during the instantiation of a command and can be retrieved for validation purposes or other logic requiring secure identification. This field is serialized and deserialized utilizing the Jackson annotation for JSON compatibility.

  • Constructor Details

    • Command

      public Command()
      Default constructor for the Command class. Initializes the Command instance with default values.

    • Command

      public Command(String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title, String token, int maxPlayers)
      Constructs a Command object with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      playerId - the unique identifier of the player
      lv - the level associated with the command
      title - the title or name of the command
      token - the token used for authentication or validation
      maxPlayers - the maximum number of players allowed

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public abstract void execute(Player player) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Executes the command logic associated with the given player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player instance on which the command will operate
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during command execution
      InterruptedException - if the execution is interrupted

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Retrieves the title associated with the command.
      Returns:
      the title of the command as a String

    • getPlayerId

      Retrieves the player ID associated with this command.
      Returns:
      the player ID as a String.

      public String getGameId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the game associated with this command.
      Returns:
      the gameId of the game as a String

    • getLv

      public int getLv()
      Retrieves the level of the command.
      Returns:
      the level (lv) associated with this command.

    • getMaxPlayers

      public int getMaxPlayers()
      Retrieves the maximum number of players allowed for this command.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of players allowed

    • allowedIn

      public boolean allowedIn(PlayerState state)
      Determines whether the command is allowed in the given PlayerState.
      Parameters:
      state - the PlayerState in which the command's allowance will be checked
      Returns:
      true if the command is allowed in the given state, false otherwise

    • getClient

      public ClientInterface getClient()
      Retrieves the client interface associated with this command. This method is marked with @JsonIgnore to exclude it from serialization.
      Returns:
      the client interface if available, or null if none is set

    • getToken

      public String getToken()
      Retrieves the token associated with the command.
      Returns:
      the token as a String.
